prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the width. The prism has the following dimensions: * Length: 0.75 m * Width: 0.75 m * Height: 0.2537 m Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin `(0, 0, 0)` with no rotation. Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw six lines to form a closed loop, as specified below: 1. Line 1: Start at `(0, 0.3248)`, End at `(0.1875, 0)` 2. Line 2: Start at `(0.1875, 0)`, End at `(0.5625, 0)` 3. Line 3: Start at `(0.5625, 0)`, End at `(0.75, 0.3248)` 4. Line 4: Start at `(0.75, 0.3248)`, End at `(0.5625, 0.6495)` 5. Line 5: Start at `(0.5625, 0.6495)`, End at `(0.1875, 0.6495)` 6. Line 6: Start at `(0.1875, 0.6495)`, End at `(0, 0.3248)` Extrusion Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.2537 m, creating a 3D solid. Part 2: Cylindrical Hole Create a cylindrical hole in the center of the prism. The cylinder has a diameter that is approximately half the width of the prism. Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following transformation: * Euler Angles: `(0, 0, 0)` * Translation Vector: `(0.0705, 0.0203, 0.2537)` This new coordinate system is located at the center of the top face of the prism and is aligned with the prism's coordinate system. Sketch Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system and draw a circle: * Center: `(0.3045, 0.3045)` * Radius: 0.3045 m Extrusion Extrude the circle along the Z-axis by 0.1269 m, creating a cylinder. Set the boolean operation to 'JoinFeatureOperation' to remove the cylindrical volume from the prism. After this operation, the final shape should resemble the provided description.</description>
